channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Graffiti sprayed on shutter next to a residential home. Location 26 Sidney road SW9 0TS., 27th November
item.description:
I like to report graffiti sprayed on a shutter next to a residents home at 26 Sidney road SW9 0TS. The graffiti is in both black and red spray paint against a silver shutter. Please can the graffiti be jet sprayed off. The graffiti has been there for over one month.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Sidney Road, Stockwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Streatham High Road SW16 1PJ number 57 ie Santander, 27th November
item.description:
Streatham High Road SW16 1PJ number 57 ie Santander Bank – a) white painted wall facing Pendennis Road and b) white gloss surface next to doorway. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor for pictures.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pendennis Road, Streatham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Insurance, benefits and navigation, time scale and attitude!, 27th November
item.description:
So many dogs. not enough space for them! Who is giving permission? No ball games for kids as no play yards! New school with 3 or 2 floors! New flats to try to get it as second ones as where to have them! 3/4 beds with reasonable prices and not for those only with 0 kids none officially and those with 3/4 or less where and those who can afford well..... Where space for me in this as last few well.... Make sure to check lights, pick up trash and trim trees in time and check street with correct cars parking around and insurance and rest of benefits too!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Marine Street, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken barrier, 27th November
item.description:
Broken barrier is here for like 2 months. Partially collapsed. Looks like the pillars are pulled of the ground. As pictures show some of the rails are unsecured and can represent danger to pedestrian during night. There is possibility the rest of the fence will go down as well after time if not being fixed

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elstree Gardens, Lessness Heath, Greater London

item.title: People placing bins and cones on public parking, 27th November
item.description:
On church road, on the left hand side, people have bought a load of cones to stop other people parking there. It was bins before. The cones are dangerous, and it is a public road. It can also become quite heated when you move these blockades.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Road, East Wickham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle used for taking drugs, 27th November
item.description:
This vehicle has been blocking my drive for a whole week now. Putting a small piece of paper stating that you have notified the owner that it is not taxed is not good enough. People are using the van for taking drugs, my 13 year old and 9 year old brought this to my attention! If something is not done about this I will refuse to pay my council tax and contact the mayor of Bromley! It is also parked on an outdated keep clear sign! This is getting ridiculous having to use my time to constantly report issues on this road!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45, Wagtail Way, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lights not working, 27th November
item.description:
The street lights come on around 5pm by which time is already very dark, the same in the morning 5am and it’s pitch dark on the street making it unsafe. Please adjust the timing. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chestnut Grove, Anerley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
